Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The sanctions against the school were a punishing blow, and they seemed to what the efforts the school had made to change? Choices:  A: ignore B: enforce C: authoritarian D: yell at E: avoid<n><n>### Response:		<n>The sanctions against the college were a penalizing blow, and they seemed for the effort the college had made to change?

Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: get smart B: boredom C: colds and flu D: taking tests E: spend time<n><n>### Response:		The good reason for attending schools is to get smart.<n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The man went to clown college, he had always want to run away with the what? Choices:  A: circus B: carnival C: surprise D: spoons E: party<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>Choices:<n><n><a href='https://postimg.cc/4NZXG4qL' target='_blank' rel='nofollow'>![clown college](https://i.postimg.cc/K1Sb0YPc/clowncollege.gif)</a><n><n>```r<n>library(ggplot2)<n>library(dplyr)<n><n>input.df <- data.frame(<n>  c("A", "b", "c", "d"),<n>  c("B", "d", "b", "a"),<n>  c("C", "e", "c", "f"),<n>  c("d", "a", "e", "f")<n>)<n><n><n># Filter column A and B<n><n># Plot the dataframe<n>head(input.df, 15)<n><n># Change the dataframe color<n><n># plot(gp_a_to_b, fill="red",color="blue",<n><n><n>```<n><n>```r<n><n>p1 <- ggplot(input.df)<n>  p1<-p1+geom_bar(aes(B, A), fill="blue")+  geom_text(aes(B, input.df$A), label="Answer")+    <n>  #facet_wrap(~B)<n>  xlab("") <n>  ylab("")<n><n>p2 <- ggplot(input.drf)<n>  p2<- p2+geom_bar (aes (input.df$output)) <n><n>#Combine 2 plot<n>p1+p2<n>```<n><n><n><n><n><img src="{{ site.baseurl }}/assets/output_21_1.png" alt="plot of numpy graph" width="933","height="128"/><n><n><n>### Output:<n><n><n>Choose how the scientist want to know the results.<n><n>Input: The lab report was compiled, the scientist started analyzing the data because he was hoping to gain what? Choices: A: learn more about an illness B: headache C to do math D: enlighed E: a better understanding<n><n>Answer: <n><n>**D: enlighed *******<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:It was a great rest, she had never felt this much what in the morning? Choices:  A: active B: hunger C: in motion D: wakefulness E: lay down<n><n>### Response:		<n>I knew I had a choice, so I searched to discover what would best meet this need. After all, it is important to find the most accurate and current information in today's highly technical age. I started by checking with my roster for anyone named "Steve Smith" and found the name immediately in the "C" columns at 1600. There are multiple uses for phonebooks, and this one just happened to be my favorite. I then searched for Steve Smith so that I could contact him directly. <n><n><n>### Input2:<n>This is the first step of my investigation of this matter, and I now find myself in a position to analyze this data because I want to know the answer for certain.<n><n>#### Reasoning:<n>You need all the data here to solve this problem.<n><n>##### Input 1:<n>I knew I needed to find accurate data for this job and decided to use a resource that is always at hand. I turned to the phone book and began by checking the "C" column for any individual with the last name "Smith", and there it was!<n><n>##### Input2:<n>I had received the answer and, by using the data, learned exactly where to find the person.<n><n>### Input3: I wanted to know if I was ready to learn math, so I called in my roster to learn more.<n><n>#### Reasons:<n>You only gave the correct answer and need to show reasoning in more depth in answer<n><n><n>### Response3:<n>I am going to learn math, <n><n>### Conclusion:<n>I wanted to know if I could solve math, so I turned to the phonebook. I found several people named Steven Smith and phoned several to see what they could tell me. I then had a deeper understanding of the answer. 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:If you're speaking to a lawyer about getting a divorce, what relationship status are you trying to end? Choices:  A: being married B: sisters C: marriage D: two people E: lawyer<n><n>### Response:		<n>Your friend has told you that he or she has an appointment with a lawyer. Your job is to ask them what they're going to the lawyer for. They might be getting a divorce. Or it could be for something else, but it's likely to be something related to divorce. So your best bet is to ask if they're getting a divorce. If they answer in the positive, that's a yes, you should say, "Well, that's unfortunate".<n><n>### Input (contd):<n>A:  Well, that's unfortinate. <n>Answer: A: Yes it is. You should move on. <n><n>### Input : The word "divorce" refers to ending a legal relationship.  <n><n>###

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Letters are sometimes delivered by hand through one of these. Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		I needed to find one of these in the building. What should I do first? Choices:  I should find out who would be able to help. 2. I should try to find out where the information needed would be. Choices: 3. I should go directly to the office. 4. I should find out more about the type of information needed. Choices: 5. I should start looking in the phone book.<n><n>### Input & Response:I couldn't find a directory, so I decided to get information on one of these. Choicies:  A: someone B: a list C: another company D: a group that would provide the answer to my question.<n><n>## Conclusion<n>This sample instruction is good. However, the responses need to match the information provided. There should be two lines for each response. The first line should identify one of the options available and include a question mark. The second line should include, answer: (letter A or answer: letter B option C or....). The second response has a misspelled word (E: better understanding), the two lines each have a question mark.

Choices:  A: shake hands B: control events C: talk to each other D: think creatively E: dress themselves<n><n>### Response:		The classroom was boring, so the instructor came up with a different way to inspire them and they started brainstorming ideas. To brainstorm ideas means to think of lots of possible solutions. This way, the students were able to think critically and then come up with a plan that helped inspire them.<n><n>### Input : When a user is trying to access a website, what usually happens during the login time? Choices: 	A: A security system pops up requesting credit card numbers B: The system checks the user's history, then proceeds to complete the login process by giving access to their information C: The user fills in all the details and the system authenticates the login D: The security system locks until the user authenticates him or herself by using a password E: All of these choices are possible (not likely, but it can happen from time-to-time)<n><n>### Response  :   Login is often a slow process because of the amount of information being processed on the server side. Because there are several things happening, the process of checking the user's computer or mobile device (to make sure they are authorized to access the site), logging in, and connecting to other systems, can take a couple of minutes.<n><n>### input  : In order to be a good leader, what characteristics should you have?Choices:   A: a person should always be able to think in a clear and concise manner. B: leadership means that you do what others think you should. C: you need good leadership qualities, such as teamwork, and respect for your team members. D: a leader should treat everyone equally and share responsibilities evenly throughout the group. E: being a good leader doesn't really require any qualities beyond your own determination. <n><n>### Response :<n>To be a leader, one must be able to work coherently as a team member, in order to be a good team leader; someone must also have excellent teamwork qualities. A person should also try to have good communication, as well as, take initiative.  They should be considerate and respectful to all team members throughout the workplace, and they are expected to have a lot of responsibility.<n><n>### <n>Input: What is a good definition for "lull"? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:John just made first violin.  This is  is a position on what? Choices:  A: violin case B: symphony orchestra C: class D: learning to play violin E: music store<n><n>### Response:		<n>* [Select the best answer from the following: B]  symphony orchestra<n><n>### Instructions:<n>* Write code that gets the correct answer above.<n>* Do not write any lines in the `Input:` space above.<n>* Only code in responses.<n>* The space to write code is on the right side of the page.<n>* Every line in the Response section must be indented 4 spaces or 1 tab.<n>* Add spaces or tabs at the beginning of lines if necessary to ensure that the lines are properly indented.<n>* You can only include code in the response section.<n>* The question will still be visible while you are writing.<n>* Do not edit the question.<n><n>## Challenge Description<n><n>## Solution<n><n>```js<n>var correctOne = function() {<n>  return B;<n>}<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n>```js <n>var correctTwo = function() {<n>    return B;<n>} <n>```<n><n>## Challenge Description 2<n><n>## Solution<n>### Instruction<n>Write a function called checkSnackName(name), where name is provided as a parameter, and you have to figure out, given the name, if it is a brand of crisp.<n><n>### Demo<n><n>Input: CheckSnackName("Sun chips")<n><n>Returns: B<n><n>Input: ChecksSnackName("Fritos")<n><n>Returns C<n><n>I.E This is the problem<n><n>Function: checkSnackName<n><n>Parameters: Name of the snack<n><n>If the snack is "Sun Chips", the function should return "B"<n><n>If the snacks is "Fritos", the function should return" C"<n><n><n>## Solution<n>Write a function called 'checkSnackName', which takes a parameter, name, as input, and returns the appropriate results based on the name of the snack.<n><n>```js<n>// Function Definitions<n>function checkSnackName (snips) {<n>  if (snips === 'Snack'){<n>    return B;    <n>  }<n>  else {<n>    return C;<n>  }<n>};<n>```<n><n><n>## Challenge<n>You and your friends (Florence, Alex, and Bella) just finished a coding class and were trying to figure

Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		They are trying to ask the next chapter, "Do what you want", or "What do you have to lose?".<n><n><n>Given a task instruction and response instruction that both include the same set of choices, write a program that asks the user to identify the correct response.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? If your response requires a yes or no answer then your response is ____. It should be clear to an instructor how to respond to you. That is you want your response to be clearly written.

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:No matter the background of the person, they should all be given what in applying for the job? Choices:  A: critical thinking B: congratulated C: equal opportunity D: compliments E: raffle tickets<n><n>### Response:		<n>C:Equal opportunity<n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B<n><n>\#python3<n>class Solution:<n>    def __init__(self):<n>        self.answers = [A: learn more about, B: headache, C: do math, D: enlightened, E: better understanding]<n><n>    def solution(self, s):<n>        #Write your code in Python. Remember to use self.<n><n>        ans=[]<n>        ans.append("A: "+self.answers[0])<n>        ans.append("\nB: "+self.ansows[1])<n>        ans.extend(self.answers[2:])<n>        ans.print("\n")<n><n>if __name__== "__main__":<n>    s=Input()<n>    s.solution(s)<n>\end{code}<n><n>Comment: What should I do to make the code more concise and elegant?<n><n>Comment: This code may work from a particular environment, but it would probably work equally well in many other environments. But it might not work where the OP is attempting to run the code.

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? She never arrives home exactly on time.<n>     --> She was always late.<n>     --> She is never early.<n>     --> She leaves work later than she wants<n>  2. I took my lunch exactly 12 mins before class ended.<n>     --> My class ended at 1:45, I always took my lunch at 1:57.<n>     --> I was exactly 17 mins early taking my lunch<n>  3. I think he will finish his assignments exactly when he said that he would.<n>     --> I thought he would finish on time<n>     --> I think he can't predict accurately how long he will take<n><n><br>She always leaves her home exactly on time. In every occasion she was late.She was always on time.<n><n>### Essay question #2:<n>Explain 'excessively'<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Examples<n>Excessively:Too much, Too much of, Excessively good, Too hot<n>Too much: Too good. more than necessary<n>Too much of: much or too much<n>Too hot: too hot<n><n><br>Excessively good means:<n><n>The quality of food or service was good but it was too much for us to eat all of it.

Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Food must be freeze dried before it is taken on what vehicle? Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		If your meal is to be freeze dried, is it really necessary to freeze dry the food to be on a vehicle? Is not your friend a vehicle? Your friend's house could be referred as one too?<n><n>### Explanation: The task above is to answer a question that contains a request (see below). It also contains a demonstration (see above).<n><n>The request in this instruction is shown in red and highlighted.<n><n>There is a task of input where you are shown choices for what might have happened to the person.<n><n>There is another task of input (the second instruction) where you are given choices for which things something might be, including "a person's speech after becoming Inebriated" (the underlined phrase is an example of a "modifier").<n><n>The explanation also shows how the input was presented as answers to a question, with each choice given as a correct "answer."<n><n>### Output:The output (the final product of running the task) is an instruction like the first task in this example.<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>### Example 1:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Expected Output<n><n>### Comments<n><n>### Example2:<n><n>#### Input<n><n>#### Demo<n><n>#### Input<n>#### Expected Output<n><n>#### Comments<n><n>## Questions & Feedback<n><n>## Submission<n><n>### Instructor Feedback<n>```<n>Instructor's Feedback for User:<USER_NAME><n>```<n><n>### User Feedback<n>```Mark this task as complete by writing: DONE```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The artist knew that this was the peak of his fandom, so he decided it was time for cashing in by doing what? Choices:  A: selling out B: happy C: fishing D: receiving money E: getting paid<n><n>### Response:		The artist knew that this was his peak of his fandom so he decided to sell his music and earn money.<n><n><n>```ruby<n>    require 'rubygems'<n>    require 'nari'<n><n>    class Question<n>        def initialize(options)<n>            @options = options || {}<n>        end<n><n>        def question_answer<n>        end<n><n>    end<n><n>    def is_answer(question_answer)<n>    end<n><n><n>ruby<n>```<n><n>```python<n>    import sys<n>    question = input('Please provide a question.')<n>    answer = question<n>    question = 'Demonstration: What is a rose?'.split()<n>    answer = 'I was asking rhetorically. There are 4 answers, all of them are correct and good one. A rose is an example of nature, you can also tell it is a flower that has long leaves that are green. People see roses in a bunch on display or someone can bring them in and present them as a gift. Flowers and plants are not only a part of nature but they can be a part of your garden, you can plant them and keep them alive and well and they will give us color and something to look at. Blowing dandelions will also give you something to look at but they are a little difficult to keep alive. Cats and kittens or puppies and puppies are a part of nature or a pet.'<n>    print answer.join(' ')<n><n>    def isAnswer(arg)<n>        a,b,c,d,e,f = arg.split()<n>        if a.capitalize() == 'P' and b.capitalize() in ['E','S','Y','N','U']:<n>            if c.capitalize()[0] == 'A' and d.capitalize()!= 'T' and e == 'S':<n>                return True<n>        return False<n><n>```<n><n>```swift<n>    protocol Question<n>        associatedtype Answer<n>        associatedtype Asker<n><n>        static func isAnswer(_ answer: Asker -> [Asker.Answer]) -> (Asker -> Bool) -> Bool<n>    end<n><n>```<n><n><n><n>```swift<n>     extension Question  <n>    {<n>        static func isQuestion(_ question: String) -> (String -> Bool) -> Bool {<n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: efficiency B: getting work done C: marriage D: finishing up E: results<n><n>### Response:		<n><p>Bride and Groom taking care of proposals is likely to be marriage because it would take a lot of time to find the appropriate groom and bride as they need to get work done to fulfill their proposals. </p><n><p>Example: They need to get a photo and have a photo album. Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? So a rosebush or squirls can be part of nature.<n><n>Demononstration: (E) To end off a conversation, one should say goodbye.<n><n>Demonstation: By being a good listener, one should be able to fully understand what is being said.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>*The response you've generated for the sample condition is for someone with the condition named CMT. <n>

Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What would you use if you wanted to make some columns of numbers? Choices:  A: roman architecture B: whitehouse C: spreadsheet D: bridge E: pantheon<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answers will vary, but the following are correct:<n><n>- **Choice A: Roman architecture:** The columns of a Roman arch were structural supports to hold the structure together, similar to the columns of a spreadsheet used to help organize information.<n>- **Choice B: White House:** The columns of the White House represent the strength of the country. In the same way, columns within a spreadsheet help organize the information and provide structure.<n>- **Choice C: Spreadsheets:** Columns in a spreadsheet organize data into specific categories. These categories can be used to find specific data more easily.<n>- **Choice D: Bridge:** Columns support a bridge and organize the materials that form a bridge. In a computer spreadsheet, the columns organize data in columns and lines that can be easily referenced for searching.<n><n>### Input? The company you worked for had 200 employees and you had an assignment to send out reminders and surveys to all of them to do with an upcoming meeting? <n><n>### Response?<n>Answers will varry but these are correct:<n><n> - **Choice A: A: Use word to email them**<n> - **Choice B: B: Do not email them just the surveys and reminders via word but instead, send it as a reminders from an app. **<n> - **Choice C: Use survey monkey software**<n> - **Choice D: A: Create a new app on your phone that you can send to people reminders and surveyp via the app. **<n><n>### Instructions? What else the word "instructions" means besides in the form of written instructions?<n>#### Answers will vary but the following are correct.<n>- **Choice A**: An order to perform a specific act.<n>- **Choice: B**: A plan of action.<n>- **Choice :C**: Help given to someone to explain what to do<n>- **Choice D**: A specific course of action.<n>

Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where would you see some people standing on a line near a road? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:If I am forgiving, what hidden force may be activated in my life? Choices:  A: nice feeling B: good karma C: respect D: new freedom E: good heart<n><n>### Response:		A: nice feeling<n><n>#### Requirements:<n>1. Write a response that describes what happens for each question you are asked. These responses need to be correct.<n><n>#### Input: <n><n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What should you do if your pens aren't work? Choices:  A: ink in B: caps C: ink cartridges D: take notes E: scribble<n><n>### Response:		<n>A) ink in, because ink will make your pens work<n>B) caps<n><n>### Explanation<n>The task requires the player to determine what they should do if their pens aren't working. The choices include "ink in", "caps", "ink cartridges", "take notes" and "scribble". The appropriate response is "ink in". The instruction to "ink in" is to add additional ink to pens by replacing empty ink cartridges. A scribble, in this case, suggests rewriting the text with notes, rather than writing something with a non-functional pen. "Caps" means replacing punctuation marks such as periods and exclamation marks in old typewriters and word processors. Replacing these punctuating marks with newer ones is not feasible for the given context.<n><n>### Input and output format<n>The below example would be an output.<n><n>```<n>PLAYER 1:Input:  What should you do if your car isn't working?  <n>Choices:  A: oil change B: mechanic C: tune up D: tires change E: drive<n>```<n><n>### The problem<n>You need to program the input and output format for the given task. Once done, the code must be able to correctly analyze the task and return an appropriate response to the player. The goal is to provide as detailed information as possible to improve the player's understanding of the game.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a movie theater along with other stores in one placE? Choices:  A: downtown area B: urban area C: new york city D: shopping mall E: military base<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. __________________ the scientist began analying the data.<n>2. __________________ I needed to find out.<n>3. __________________ something will happen to someone's words.<n>4. __________________ are part of.<n>5. __________________

Choices:  Choices: A: If my wife wants to buy flowers, I want her to go to the florist. B: My father wants to keep my dog's leash out of the house unless he is walking the dog. C: Whenever my wife wants my support, can she do it? D: I want to be able to buy groceries for my family. E: All of them.<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: If my wife wants<n>B: My father wants<n>C: Whenever my wife<n>D: I want...<n>E: All of them<n><n>### Input <n>Input: Which of the following will likely make a person's voice sound worse than usual? Choices: A: yelling B: talking C: talking clearly D: yelling E: yelling<n><n>### Response <n><n>A: yelling and talking will probably make it worse D: A and C and D will make it seem worse because a<n><n>### Input (Note these are answers), When was the last time you took a look at these? Choices:  B: a couple of years ago C: five years ago D: a year ago E last month<n><n>### Response (Note these are answers)<n>A. five years ago<n>B. a couple of years ago<n>D. last month<n><n>## Author Information<n><n>| Name | Phone |<n>|:-----|:-----|<n>| Nicole | 106 |<n>

Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is an example of information literacy, a skill that will serve you for many years.<n><n>### Input 2 : A group of four people at the library were trying to decide the best computer to use and they needed help finding documentation related to which of the following? Choices:  <ul class="indent"> <li>A: the 4chan website B: the wiki page for the group</li> <li>C: a website about Star Wars</li> <li class="right-aligned">D: a website on programming</li> <li style="float:left;">E: a website from 2010</li> </ul><n><n>### Response 2:<n>What I learned from my research is that A,B, and C are all different subjects. Only D and E are related to the group.<n><n>### Output:A person who can access and retrieve information from various sources in an efficient and effective manner is called? Choices:  What:  A: A knowledgeable B: A researcher C: A scientist D: An information literate E: A Google researcher <n><n>### Output 2: The answer to the previous question is:<n>Information literacy is a skill that one has when they can find, retrieve, use and manage information from a variety of sources in an efficient and appropriate manner. This is also referred to as information literacy which is a big deal and will benefit you greatly in all aspects of your life.<n><n>  **[See the full source code](./examples/information_literacy.md) for more details!**<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What could happen to a paper if you leave it outside even if it does not move? Choices:  A: one material often recycled B: ripped C: saturated with water D: one dimensional E: crumpled<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The paper may be ripped because sometimes paper will shrink in the rain and a person might leave their paper out.<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>The answer to each question may or may not have one single right answer. If more than one answer is acceptable, provide both the correct answer, as well as any equally correct answers.<n><n>### Resources<n><n>Garrett, J. N. & Searson-Saunders, Michael. (2017). Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What kind of driving leads to accidents? Choices:  A: stressful B: dangerous C: fun D: illegal E: deadly<n><n>### Response:		B: dangerous<n><n>### Note:<n><n>Inputs: What are some positive qualities of driving safely? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:He had done a great job with the scary decorations, they were completely what? Choices:  A: terrible B: little C: halloween D: small E: horrible<n><n>### Response:		He did a great job with terrific decorations.<n>\end{code}<n><n>Answer: \begin{code}<n>import random<n>import string<n>import textwrap<n><n>instructions.append(<n>textwrap.dedent(<n>    """\<n>    ### Input:<n>    Choices: A, B, C, D, E. Input: E<n>    ### Result:<n>    B.<n>    """<n>    "\n"<n>).strip())<n><n>instructions_result = ""<n>random_word_choices = ["A", "B", "C", "D", "E"]<n>random.shuffle(random_word_choises)<n>for i in random_word_choises:<n>instructions_choices.append(<n>    textwrap.dedent(f"### Choice: {i}\nAnswer: {i}").strip())<n><n>def replace_and_return(instructions, instructions_result, replacement_dict):<n>    all_instructions = str(instructions).split("\n")<n><n>    for instruction in all_instructions:<n>        for i in replacement_dict["choices"]:<n>            current_line = instruction.replace("### Choice:", f"The task asks for a response, in return, answer the following question: [{i}]")<n>            current_line += replacement_dict["response"]<n>            instructions_result += current_line<n><n>    return instructions_result<n><n>replace_and_return(<n>    instructions, instructions_result, {"choices": ["B", "C",<n>            "D"], "response": "The answer must be B as the lab results had been compiled by the scientist."})<n>\end{code}]<n><n>Answer: I am not sure what you aim to achieve but could you try something like this:<n><n>\begin{code}<n>choice = input('Please enter a choice: ')<n>instructions = open ('instructions.txt')<n>instructions.readline()<n>line = instructions.next()<n>if line == '### Choice:'+ choice + '':<n>    print(textwrap.dedent("The task asks for a choice: " + choice + "."))<n>else:<n>    print("It is not a correct choice.")<n>\end{code})<n><n>

Choices: <n>A: solve this equation B: do algebra C: write a math function D: solve for the variable I: other<n><n>Answer:<n>A: solve this expression<n><n>Input: What do I need to do to complete my arithmetic exercises?<n><n>Input: What did you need to do to solve this equation?<n><n>Input: The solution for this equation is???<n><n>Input: What value will the solution for this equation equal?<n><n>Input: To solve an equation you need to:<n><n>### Response<n><n>* You solved an expression<n>* You wrote a function<n>* You used an equation<n>* To solve this expression you need to.......<n>* You should to use....... to get the answer<n><n>### Input<n><n>Girl 1: How did you know how to solve the problem<n>Girl 2: I did what??<n>

Because this sentence says that he might do something. Moreover, this response is an active sentence. Furthermore, we use the subject, verb, and object in this sentence. I guess we could also explain this sentence with a different strategy as follow : He may laugh because he has fun.<n>

When we are going to buy a large amount of clothes, we do so at a discount price. When the weather begins to warm up, the sun rises.<n><n>### Choices:<n>```<n>A. B. <n>```<n>Choices: A. C. D. E.<n><n>### Answer:<n>#### A:<n>1. This word is used when we tell someone to do something we consider to be very important.<n>2. This word is something that makes it easier to do a job.<n>3. This word is an example of a very difficult job.<n>4. This words is used when someone cannot find something or understand something.<n>5. This word is something done that is very easy.<n><n>#### B.<n>```<n>1. The correct words are: When someone begins to work a certain job, there may be many changes required, but these are not always made. <n>2. We could tell someone to do something that is more important, but we would not tell them to stop the job. <n>3. A person has the right to ask or make request about what he or she can or cannot do, whether or not they are working because of something that they are legally required to do. A job or responsibility does not necessarily need to have all the problems before the person would stop.<n>4. A person's job may have become more difficult, but usually such a person will be successful in his or her job. If the person is doing the job, he or she will likely do it. <n>5. We must make sure that someone else is doing the job, and we must give the person the right to do it. <n>```<n>#### C.<n>```<n>1.'Why not'  means that if someone asks why they cannot do something, a person can tell them. It can also be used when people ask a person to allow them to take more time off.<n>2. A person

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:while luck plays a big role, every person who is great at something has focus and what to it? Choices:  A: hatred B: surprised C: compliments D: dedication E: solutions<n><n>### Response:		A: dedication<n>### Input: When people are in doubtful situation, it's best to? Choices:  a: remain calm b: cry c: remain confident d: remain alert e: all of the above<n><n>### Response : All of the above<n><n># Code<n>import re<n><n>data = ["C: phone book",<n>        "A: hatred",<n>        "C: nature",<n>        "A->N",<n>        "D: talk nonsense",<n>        "I needed to find out how",<n>        "B: michigan",<n>        "B - N",<n>        "D - N",<n>        "<nature, roster, etc.>",<n>        "B -> N",<n>        "A - N",<n>        'E: better understanding',<n>        'D - N',<n>        'C: nature',<n>        'E -> N',<n>        'B - N',<n>        '<person who is great at is',<n>        'C-N']<n><n>def main():<n>    for i in data:<n>        # search for the name of the place<n>        place = re.search("(N - C", i).group()<n><n>        # if the answer was found<n>        if place == 'N':<n>            for j in data:<n>                # compare words in the first part<n>                if i == re.search("[A-Z. ]", j) and re.search(",", i) == re.search(",", j):<n>                    # If they're the same and have two commas, the words are in the right order<n>                    print(j)<n>                    print('The correct word is: ', re.search("[ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ]", j))<n>                    return<n>            <n>            print('OOPS NOT FOUND')<n>            return<n><n>            <n><n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    main()<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:He was looking for the holiday decorations and found an old box of clothes up where? Choices:  A: attic B: trash C: loft D: closet E: box<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A&nbsp;C B&nbsp;E&nbsp;D C&nbsp;E&nbs...<n><n>### Instrucion:<n><n>Answer: The lab results had compiled, the scientist started to analyse data, because he wanted to learn more about, so he can know better.<n><n>Example 2 - Input:<n><n>I wanted to know how contact someone with a certain name, so my first choice should be, find in a phonebook.<n><n>Input 3 - Answer:<n><n>Input 3- Question: what happen to a person's speech after becoming intoxicated.<n><n>Answer: Talk nonsense.<n><n>Inputs 4 - Answer:<n><n>Answer: A rosebush, a squirrel and other plants and animals are in natures.<n><n>Input 5 - Response:<n><n>In an attic.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>This is Solution for Question 1<n><n>```java<n><n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>public class ReadLineDemo {<n><n>    public static void main(String [] args){<n>        int count=0;<n>        int index=0;<n>        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);<n>        System.out.println("Enter Question 1");<n>        System.out.print("Enter your answer: ");<n>        String ans = sc.next();<n>        while (ans!= null) {<n>            if (ans.equals("A")) {<n>                System.out.println ("Bingo!");<n>                count++;<n>            }<n>            else if (ans.equalsIgnoreCase("C")) {<n>                index++;<n>            }<n>             else if (ans.matches(String.valueOf(index))) {<n>                 System.out.println (String.valueOf(count ) +"+"+ String.valueOf(index));<n>                 index++;<n>                 count = 0;<n>            }<n><n>        System.out = sc.next(); <n>        }<n><n>    }<n><n>}<n>```<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What is someone watching a person who is playing guitar doing? Choices:  A: auditioning B: hear sounds C: listening to music D: making music E: arthritis<n><n>### Response:		What is someone playing a game of pool?<n>#### Example 1:<n>`What is someone who is playing pool doing?`<n><n>#### Example 2:<n>`Jim and I are going to the movies to watch a movie and do what?`<n><n>#### Rules:<n>```<n>If the "what" in "What is x doing?" and "And I" are identical, then the answer is "see"<n>```<n>Example:<n>`The boy wants to learn to fly and so does he. Now we are flying to our destination`<n>**Correct Answe**: `The boy and so does the boy want to learn to fly.`<n>Example<n>`The boy wants me to clean his room and the boy wants. Then me to clean his room`<n><n>**Correct Answeb**: `The boy to clean his room and wants me to clean his. Now his room`<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write your code to complete the following tasks.<n><n>## Running Tests<n>To run tests, type `pytest` from within `myfirst`.<n><n>## Debugging<n><n>To debug a single test:<n><n>1.  In a working `myfirst` in another location, run `pytest`<n>2.  On the command line, ensure that `myfirst` is working by entering `py --version`.<n>3.  In the `myfirst` shell, type `pytest <test_filename_under_debugging>`<n><n>In `myfirst` in the terminal, type `python3 -m pdb <test_filename_to_debugger>`<n><n>## Further Reading<n><n>For reference, here are some articles on Python Testing best practices.<n><n>* [The Basics of Testing Your Python Code<n>* [Test Driven Development with Python<n>* [Understanding Python Unittest Tests<n>* [Using Pytest and Conftest to Write Better Tests<n>

Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What could you do if you want to listen to music? Choices:  A: skate B: play piano C: fiddle D: play piano E: have fun<n><n>### Response:		<n>Music is often played when people are having fun or doing hard work.<n><n>### Input<n>What is the difference in what music is played with respect to how it is played? Choices: <n> A: what is played is how it is played B: how it is played is how is played C: how it is played are what is played D: how it is played and how is played E: how is played and it is played<n><n>### Response<n><n>Play how (when, why) music is played is a different choice.<n><n><br><n><br><n><n>### Instructions:Choose one of the following options for the question to answer.<n><n>### Options:<n>1. Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:When you are expressing yourself by yelling after getting a bruise, what are you feeling? Choices:  A: self pity B: communication C: understood D: pain E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		When you are expressing yourself after getting a bruise by yelling, then you obviously feel embarrassment because you are embarrassed if people around you know. Also, the person is feeling pain since he did something and he is feeling embarrassment because the person is embarrassed if the people around him know.<n>The reason for my response is because: To start with, if people around me know what happened I can feel embarrassed. After all, if the people around know what happened then I will likely feel embarrassed.  Moreover,  if I get a bruise then I cant feel like I understood what happened. For example, bruising a body part could be explained as you have communicated your self to me then I wouldnt feel embarrassed or understood. To be exact, being embarrassed means you are embarrassed when someone around you is watching.<n>In addition, to be concise, how could one feel self pity from a bruise? The most you could feel is embarrassment or pain then you wont feel self pity thats for certain.<n><n>### Input : What happened as a result of the collision of two galaxies?<n><n>### Response(s): <n><n>### Input<n><n>The scientist was looking for answers, and he wanted to find out what. Write a response that includes as much complete information as possible to explain the question.<n><n>## Input: There are people that work in different countries, so we have two sets, one set is people that work in America, and the other set of people is those people that work in China. Choices: A: work for China B: work in China C: work in America D: work for America E: work for China, or work in America.<n><n>## Reply<n><n>### Response :<n><n>The majority of the people who work for China, work there, but the majority of those people who do, also work in America.<n>There are more members of the second group than there are people who belong in the first group.<n>Most of the Americans who work for China, also work in America<n><n>### Input A: Which way is it? There is a chance that the situation will end with a surprise. Choices: A) going bad B) going to get better C) good or better D) go in two directions E) going somewhere.<n><n>### Reply<n><n>The situation is likely either to improve and remain positive, or for it to turn bad and even worse.<n>Things have a chance of either getting better or worse

Choices:  A: farm B: ancient rome C: history book D: poor countries E: plantation<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you need to ask a question that is not on the list, use 'other' for both 'What would you like to get?', 'To whom would you like to send a message?<n><n>```python<n>import sys<n><n>sys.path.append('.')<n><n>from engrlol import engrlolSolve<n>from engrloloop import createEngrlolLoop<n><n><n><n>l = 3<n><n><n><n>def engrlolSolute_L(arglol: int, a: int):<n>    n = 10 ** a if a!= 0 else 0<n>    retln: list = []<n>    arglol = 0<n>    retn: list = []<n><n>    rf = [0]<n><n>    for x in range(1, n + 1):<n>        y = x ** (arglol)<n>        z = x ** (arg + 1)<n><n>        a = y + z<n>        b = y - z + x<n>        c = y - z - x<n>        d = y - z + l<n>        e = y - z - rf<n><n>        retn.append(retln)<n>        retln.append(a)<n><n>        rf.append(b)<n><n><n>def createEngrLolLoop_L(n: int, a:int, arglol: int) -> int:<n>    f = lambda: arglol<n>    g1_l: lambda: f()<n>    g1: list = g1_l()<n>    g2_l: lambda: arglol*f()<n>    g2: list = g2_l()<n>    l = len(g2_l())<n>    n_l: int = arglol<n>    s = 0<n>    x = []<n><n>    for i in range(0, l):<n>        z_l: int = g2_l();<n><n>        if i == 0:<n>            k_l: int = x.append(z_l)<n><n>             for i in range(1, k_l + 1):<n>                 y_l: int = z_l<n><n>                if (i+1) == k_l + 2:<n>                    f_l = x.append(f())<n>

Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:A shark swam in the background aquarium as the card players sat emotionless, what were they playing? Choices:  A: sea world B: court room C: shallow waters D: poker game E: card shark<n><n>### Response:		Court Room<n><n><n>### Input<n>The man asked this question from the man he met at a book sale: Is this book cheaper in other bookstores in this city? What city is the man from? Choices:  Book Sales: The Big Apple, NJ, New York B Bookstores: All the bookstores in the city<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>Different, NJ<n><n><n>### Output:<n><n>The man said:<n>All the bookstores have different prices.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Input is a sentence as described above. Write a response that is based on the sentence.<n><n>Your classmate has found several errors in their lab results, how can they make sure those errors are corrected?<n>Write an email to your classmate:<n>-	Explain what your lab partner did wrong.<n>-	Review what data should be corrected.<n>-	List how you or your classmate should correct the errors.<n>-	Describe how your classmate can avoid making errors in the future.<n>Email is 80 words per response.<n><n>### Input is the lab results file<n>Labor Report, Rough Draft, Final Report<n><n>### Instructor's Sample Responses<n>Labor Report, Draft Sample<n><n>#### Demonstration:	Email to classmate<n><n>Email to classmate:<n>- I forgot to enter 4.0 degrees C for the water temperature - enter -0.4 degrees C instead.<n>- I forgot to subtract 1.7 from the water's pH - subtract 2.7 instead.<n>- I was mistaken and the reaction of my sample was not as the textbook stated - record this is your data sheet as another reaction.<n><n><n>#### Demonstraion:	<n><n>Email to classmates:<n><n>I realized that my experiment was faulty because of these errors. I made a mistake of mixing the results of the 4 tests into a single data set instead of having a separate data set for each individual test. This is my mistake and is not the fault of the textbook. If I make improvements to my data sheets in other situations, I will not make these mistakes.<n>		<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where did the compassionate farmer allow the heifer to reside during her last days? Choices:  A: cattle ranch B: countryside C: grocery store D: slaughterhouse E: dairy farm<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n><n>- I chose A for the first question, but he could have looked in the directory as well, which would be correct.<n><n>- For the second question, I chose D because a person would get drunk and talk incoherently.<n><n>- I chose nature for the third question, in which nature is where flora, fauna and human habitats exist.<n><n>- I answered B for the last question because that is where the heifer was going to live because it is the countryside.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>answer = 'none'<n>def do_problem():<n>  answer = 'none'<n>  problems = ['directory', 'drunk driving', 'field']<n>  while answer == 'none': <n>    question = input('Input: What is likely going to happen to someone' + \<n>                   's speech after becoming intoxicated?'+ \<n>                    '\n' + 'Choices: ').split()<n>    for i in problems:<n>      if int(question[0]) == i:<n>        answer = problem[0]<n>        break<n>    else:<n>      choose = input('Input:'+ choice)<n>      if choose == question[0]:<n>        answer = problem.get(i)<n>        break<n>```<n><n><n>Output:<n>```<n>Do the problem? [y, y, y, y]<n>Input: What is going to happen to someones speech when they are intoxicated? Choices:<n>A: say a lot B: cant understand C: lose words E: talk intelligently Answer: A: say a lot<n>Input: Where did the compassion man put the heifer to rest during her final days? Choices:<n>B: countryside E: beef slaughter facility Answer: B: Countryside<n>Input: Input: I went in search of my neighbor to find out where he was because I wanted... Answer: E: better understanding <n>Input: Where should I look to find out how to reach someone with a particular name? Choices:<n>E: beef slaughters Answer: B: directory<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: church B: theatre C: large city D: water fountain E: central park<n><n>### Response:		Church<n><n>### This question asks what?<n><n>Answer:<n><n>This question asks me what are two places where a statues can be placed. Because I'm choosing between two options, I choose the Church and Central Park.<n><n>### This next question also asks what? But which answer matches these clues?<n><n>Answer: <n>"There are a myriad of plants and animals that make up a park. The word myriad means large and plentiful and park has a lot of plants and animals."<n><n>### This is what the next question means:<n><n>Answer:<n>B) Because the person is thinking back to when they were in school and the teacher used a projector, he is most likely talking about a chalkboard, which he calls a visual.<n><n>### A:<n><n>Answer: 1)  An apartment is a place to live within a building owned by a landlord.<n>2)  A house is a place to live with your family.<n>3) A dorm is a room where students live while they attend college.<n>4) A condo is a place to live which you own and it is usually much smaller that an apartment or a house.<n>5) A studio apartment is a place you live in a small apartment which also houses a living and a bedroom in one area.<n><n>### B:<n><n>Answer: Housing is a home but its not the only thing. Housing includes:<n><n>1. Apartment<n>2. Condo<n>3. Townhouse<n>4. Mobile Home<n>5. Land<n>6. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:People always talked childlike to him, even though his disability was physical and didn't affect his what? Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n><n>### Response:		<n>A. Yes, Dylan has a cognitive disability of some degree and as such, many people (unfortunately) talk to him as though he is a child, including all the people he's ever interacted with - school, friends, coworkers, etc. However, Dylan _does_ have a degree of brain potential that others don't understand about those with cognitive disabilities, and some people that don't know that also believe he is incapable of higher cognitive levels. If Dylan had a cognitive disability (like a speech, language or emotional disability) of a milder degree or a physical disability (such as blindness, or deafness), people would not treat him as though he was a child as he would be seen by others as being at more of a cognitive _or_ physical disadvantage (those were the two _only_ choices listed), and therefore, wouldn't be speaking to him or looking at him in the same way.

Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: water B: liquid C: foamy D: intoxicating E: harmful<n><n>### Response:		A, C, E   <n><n>### Output:The scientist began analyses because he wants the better understanding.<n><n>### Program:<n>```js<n>//function to test whether the input is a multiple choice<n>function multipleChoiceTest(input) {<n>  var regex = /Choices: ([^\]]*)\s?/i;<n>  console.log(input.match(regex)[1]);<n>}//function ends<n><n>//Asking question from the prompt and print all possible answers<n>function question(input) {<n>	//Asking question<n>	console.log('Answer the following multiple choice:'+<n>				input.replace(/\w+\s*$/, ''));<n><n>	//printing all the answers<n>	console.log(multipleChoiceTest(input));<n>}//function ends;<n><n>question('What is likely to happen to a person's speech after becoming drunk?');//this is the output<n>question('Long term consumption of bee can lead to ');//this is the output

I think all of these options are relevant.<n><n>### The car may have been serviced.<n><n>### There is possibly a fuel leak, if there is a faulty fuel injector, this could be a cause for all of your symptoms, but I also have a few more suggestions. I think a transmission problem could also be affecting you since you said your car was making a clunking sound. It is possible there is a fluid leak, which is why I suggested looking a the transmission. I suggest an oil change.<n><n>### It will be hard to drive with all of these issues.<n><n>### If the issues continue, there is no need to look at something as small as a filter when the problem could be bigger than that. Fuel leaking is a rather common issue if it is from a faulty fuel injecter. I have seen this happen, and it is a simple fix. Other than that I think the problem may be bigger, such as fuel leaking. I have heard that a faulty fuel injectors could cause such issues, but for me it was always a fuel leak. Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:How often are secular parties held? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write an expression using conditional statement that returns True if the following expression returns True:<n>- if n < 10 and n > 5<n><n>### Output:<n>-  A boolean value that returns true<n><n>```js<n>if n >= 10 && n <= 5<n>  return 2<n><n>else<n>  return 0<n>```<n><n>### Notes:<n>Do not use the 'else' at the end for another conditional, just return 0 if n does not meet the initial condition.<n><n>### Notes#2:<n>If and (logical AND) is the logical combination of two statements, where you must return true on both side for the entire condition to be true.<n><n>### In order to get TRUE, you have to put an additional condition onto the two conditions already stated.<n><n>### What has to be done:<n>- A. Add two more additional conditions.<n>- B. Add two more additional expressions.<n>- C. Add two more additional if statements.<n>- D. Add one more additional boolean variable<n><n>### Test:<n> - n >= 6 && (n <= 1 && n <= 4)<n><n>### If Statement for Condition 1:<n>We must use 2 conditions because if there is just one, it will be True all the time, i.e. all the numbers will return 1<n><n>### Test 2:<n>- A.<n>- B. <n><n>### Conditional Statement<n><n>```javascript<n>let condition1 = (n >= 10 && (n <= 5 || n >= 6))<n>let condition2 = (1 <= n && (n <= 4 || n >= 6 && n <= 8))<n><n>if (condition1  && condition2){<n>  console.log("true");<n>} else {<n>  console.log(`false`);<n>}<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:She wanted to make a quilt of velvet, where should she look? Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Answer: A and E are related choices. All other choices are unrelated.<n>```<n><n>### Input What is the name of the country where you were born? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? Choices:  A: own home B: old england C: new hampshire D: coffin E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		None of the choices is likely to where a small dog would be found. The first two choices indicate the country from which people immigrate to the U.S. New England is not in England and New Hampshire is not in England The third and fourth choices are states in the U.S., but they are not English territories.<n><n>### Input:"I need to go to a grocery store."<n><n>### Response:"What type of store should I go to?"<n><n>### Input:'I see a building next to the highway.'<n><n>### Response:'What building is that?'<n><n>### Input:- "I'm a police officer."<n><n>###Response:- "You say that you are a police officer?"<n><n>###Input:- "Let's talk."<n><n>###Respose:- "I would be happy to talk."
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The band enjoyed their success and fans, they loved to what at the start of every concert? Choices:  A: hear crowd go mad B: working hard C: clap D: reproduce E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		D - Reproduce<n><n>### Input:(The band) loved to begin each show.<n>### Demontration: The verb 'enjoy' is intransitive because enjoy is a 3rd person singular verb without object.<n><n>### Input : My mother was in the kitchen preparing lunch when she noticed my brother spitting and coughing.<n>### Demostration: The verb 'noticed' is intransitive. It does not take any object because it is an action without receiver.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>Intransitive verb cannot have an object as its complement when the main verb is in the form -ing.<n>

He didn't heave anything to put it on, and he lacked the what to balance it? Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		The man set the cup on what? Choices: A: The table B: floor<n><n>### Demostration:<n>* The man set the cup - what he did<n>* What he did didn't matter - it isn't a concern<n>* Why it doesn't matter is he didn't heave the anything - he didn't have something to rest it on<n>* What didn't matter is he lacked the what - was he broke<n>* What if he lacked the what would he have done?<n>* If he had what, he would have put down what?<n><n>---
