Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:He made another call, he did this all day hoping people would what well to his offer? Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n><n>### Response:		<n>There were many different options he could offer people but the one that stood out was an offer that was the most common thing and made an instant connection with the people that called or texted him. He offered them an iphone, but they would not accept because if they did what would happen to their current telephone, and most importantly their car. For most people their car is all they need to have the best life but they can't get by without a computer or phone, so he was giving them the choice. He asked them which would they like to receive first and they all said the phone and he just gave them the phone, because what's the worse that could happen? At least they could tell him why they would need a phone later, and after seeing how many people he had received a phone from they came back with excuses because they wanted the phone.

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Bob's feet hurt from running barefoot on the hot pavement.  I lost his shoes, didn't know where they landed, and had to run from the corner store to his home.  About where did he run? Choices:  A: a bed of nails B: town C: attractive consistent look D: city block E: ground<n><n>### Response:		What is E, the answer to 'Bob's shoes?  City block<n><n>### Explanation:<n>This question looks pretty easy, and if the input is understood the answer should be easy.  The best way to answer this is to analyze the input and the answer, and try to find what is common to both.  The questions seems to be multiple choice (A or B or C or D or E), however the last one, 'lost his shoes', changes the answer to 'city block' instead of one of the other choices.  The city block is the answer because Bob's feet are no longer in the city, his feet are now on the ground, they are free of the city.<n><n>*<n>### Instruction<n>Create a function named myBank() that is a public subroutine.<n>### Demontration<n>Input:  <n>Input a double variable.  When the program runs, print out the value of that variable.<n><n>### Input<n>Input= $12.1<n><n>### Output<n>12.1<n>### Explanaton:<n>Creating a public subroutine is good practice.  You create public subroutines like a class method (method() from the java class).  This tells the computer to call the function that is created to perform the desired task.  The $12.1 is the default first argument in our sample and can be any type of data that can be converted to a double (float).<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple choices question.<n><n>Input: The amount of caffeine contained in 10 milliliters of regular instant coffee is 34 milligrams. what is the amount of caffe in 8 ounces of the same coffee? They could have made it much easier with a small hint.<n><n>---<n>layout: post<n>title: What I've learned about Computer Programming<n>---<n><n>I have been studying Computer Engineering and Programming for many years. While attending college I have learned a significant amount about Computer Science and am still learning from the many classes I have taken to date. Everyone in Computer Engineering needs to know Programming if one wants to develop their software into becoming a full project.<n><n>My first class ever was Logic Design, where I learned about the many things in computer hardware. The other class I could remember is Programming 1 and 2. I took those courses many years before I began college.<n><n>**In my first programming 1 class I learned a lot, not only in how to program the projects my teacher gave us, but also a lot about what programming was, especially on the C language.**<n><n>Some of the concepts I learned in Programming 1 class were variables, string, and arrays. I learned about variables in Programming 1. I also learned about string in programming 1. In programming 1 I learned to do arrays.<n><n>**In programming 2, I did projects.**<n><n>In programming 2 I learned some more things. I learned about conditional statements, loops, constants, structure, operators, statements, functions, expressions, conditionals, if statements, if-else statements, and statements. Choices:  Choices:  A tadpole. B: It is neither.  C: A male tadpole.  D: A female adult tadpole.  E: A male tadpoles.<n>Answer: A: It is neither.<n><n>### Input:#1 You need to take a shower before leaving for work.  #2 She took a nap when she got home from school.  #3 He ate dinner when it was time to eat.  #4 The man put on his coat when it started to rain.<n>Answer: "When (one thing) (another thing)" "She took a nap (when) (she was) home from (school)."  The correct words to complete the sentence are:  <n>1) A: shower  <n>2) A: nap 3) A: ate 4) A: rain<n><n>### What if your spelling was so bad that you had to do something?<n>If your spelling was so (bad) that you (had to do something), what (you do)? <n><n>Answer: If your spelling was so _______ you (did something), what (you did)?<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? Choices:  A: boredom B: patience C: time D: teachers E: inspiration<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n><n>### Explanation:<n><n><h1 id="explanation">Instruction</h1><n>`The scientist` _(A)_ _begin analysing_ `the data` _(E)_ _because he wanted better understanding_.<n>`What is likely to happen to` _(D)_ `someone`s speech after becoming in?ebriated?`<n>`A rosebush`,`a squirrel`,`or other plants and` _(A)_ are part of what?<n>`Nature` _(A)_ `is part of` `park`,`these are not valid for the two places`.<n>`To properly instruct children atteding school` _(E)_ `you would need a great deal` `of...`<n>`teachers`. _(E)_<n><h5 id="explanation-of-A">(A) Boredom</h5><n>This answer does not make sense, but there is no contradiction.<n><n><h5 id ="explanation_of_b">(B) Patience</h5><n>There is no contradiction.<n>```<n><p><n><span class="n">I </span><span class="w">needed</span> to <span class="p">find out </span>how to <span class="v">contact a person with </span><span class ="v">a </span><span class = "n">certain name </span>. <n>```<n>  There is no contradiction to the input phrase(s) and the output example.<n><n><h3 id="explanation_C">(C) Time</h3><n>This answer does **not** contain a contradiction.<n><n><a id='explanation_D">(D) Teachers</a><n>No, there is no contradiction. <n><n><h3>Explanation of E (E) Inspiration</h3><n>There is no contradition.<n><n><n>```<n><p data-latex=" \displaystyle \sqrt{5}\neq5$"><n>This answer does not contain any contradiction.<n>The example sentence is also very vague and seems like it is asking whether or not squares have lengths that are equal to themselves, but is asking for the length, rather than the square of the length. <n><n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What do rich people like in terms of bagels? Choices:  A: poor B: sleepy C: plain D: needy E: homeless<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would call up my dear friends at a bagel shop. I would tell them the things that rich people like in terms with their bagels.  I would tell them to bake more plain ones and to serve them in very big size so that they can feel how big the bagel was. I would also suggest them to put some cream cheese on the bagel and the rich ones will like it. Besides, I would tell them to add some berries like strawberry or blackberry to give the plain ones a more exotic look, or even to put something sweet in the bagels like chocolate. I would also call them to bake some chocolate chip bagels to please the rich customers more.<n><n>#### Notes:<n>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bagel<n>https://www.bagelbaker.com/articles/3-tasty-ways-to-eat-bagels<n><n>### Input What does the abbreviation (USPS) mean? Choices: <n><n>Answer: U.S. Postal Service

Where would you get the bass clarinet?<n><n>Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question, then show the difference between two answers.<n><n>###Instruction A:Why did Paul go to the bank? Choices: A: to go to a concert B: to deposit money C: to withdraw money D: to eat dinner E: to cash a check F: to apply for a loan<n><n>* Instruction B:Answer the next question, where can Paul use his debit card to get something to eat? Choices: A,B,C,D,E,F<n><n>Response: The best answer is B because Paul would use his debit card in the grocery story in order to get something to eat.<n>Paul did not eat dinner, he did go to a concert, did not apply for a loan, did not go to the bank for a cash check, did not go to a concert.<n>The other answer is A, but not C because the concert is only a choice at night.<n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What would release energy, but not mainly in your muscles? Choices:  A: vent B: think C: shouting D: work off E: exercise<n><n>### Response:		Choice: A: vent<n>The energy could be released in the vocal chords, and also in the muscles.<n><n>### Input (Continued): Do what? Choices: A: talk B: run C: smile D: relax E: nothing<n>Answer: D: relax<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question regarding the given statement.<n><n>### The above statement means a person can think but not talk or that a person can think but also talk. Write a response that describes what the given statement means.<n><n>### A: I'm afraid of heights and I know that the fear is rational and reasonable. Therefore, I think I can never learn to fly. This is because my fear of heights is so strong that it will deter me from learning to fly or accomplish my goal.<n><n>B: If I'm afraid of flying, I know that the feeling is not real and that I'm not in any real danger. Therefore, I think that I could learn the skills necessary to fly without any problem. Because I know that I'm not really afraid of flying and because I think I can learn these new skills, I can conquer my fear.<n><n>### Response to the given statement: Choice B: If I'm<n><n>### Instructor: Answer the following.<n><n>### What is likely to be more likely to get caught with a criminal record? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The new kitten hadn't gotten used to what it was allowed to climb on in most rooms, so the owned kept the bedroom door what? Choices:  A: opened B: closed C: found at shower D: falling down E: locked<n><n>### Response:		The new kitten hadn'ta gotten used to climbing on the bed in the most rooms so it's owner kept the bedroom door open.<n><n>### Explanations:<n>You will need to have a look back at the task. Below are the first few commands.<n><n>### Input<n><n>This command does not change the name of the variable, but it tells the program to enter data, hence the 'Enter' key.<n>`$Enter`<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Next follow what is written in the first instruction above.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>The program is looking for what, so to answer, it takes the first four letters of that. For this you will need to be careful that you enter one of the chosen letters. 'D' stands for 'Do' or 'Determine'. It does depend on which word you enter, for example 'Head' would end in 'head'.<n><n>### Explination<n><n>The second command is 'Input.' It is important to realise that an Input command always comes at the start of a section, in this case it is the second section.<n><n>### Command<n><n>The third command instructs the program to keep going, without stopping.<n><n>### Section<n><n>A section is where you have more than one command. The beginning and ending of a section is given with an 'Section.'<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>This is where 'Demonstration' comes in, for the second section, where 'Input,' comes before input and the second input comes after the 'Section' command. The program is waiting for what it is looking for, to finish asking questions. It's looking for what type of book, so to answer, you need to enter the answer to the question.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>`section`<n>```<n>$Enter<n>Input: The lab test results had been compiled, a scientist began analyzing the data because he or she wanted what? Choices A: Determine, B: Do not want to learn more, C: Do not understand the science, D: Do not understand more, E: Want to understand better.<n><n>$Input <n><n>Input: I need to find out how to get in touch with someone with the name, where should I go? Choices: A: Directory, B: Michigan, C: Register, D: Phone Book, E:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where do you keep a teakettle? Choices:  A: cupboard B: countertop C: water D: hardware department E: england<n><n>### Response:		I usually keep my teakettle on my countertop.<n><n>### Input<n>The lab results had been compiled<n>what: a group or set of things<n>was compiled: when something such as a list, story, or report, has been put in particular order, or got organized<n>had been: the past<n>because: for<n>he wanted: a person's desire, wish, or craving<n>what: a thing or objects<n>to: where<n>because he wanted: because<n>a group or set of things: group or set of things, not something<n>got organized: get information and then put it into particular order<n>the past: past event<n>what: a thing<n>he wanted: his desire, his wish, his craving<n>to: for<n>to become: become<n>what: to become<n>to become organized: become organized<n>to become order: become organized<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a response that appropriately complete the request.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? The question states that the location of the blow fish does not have to be near America. Since the United States is large it has many locations. Therefore I choose the most logical answer to fill that description.

"A" and "B"<n>## Why does the author not use any identifying information (name, email, age, etc) in her post?<n>### <n>### Answer:<n>The only thing that the author is willing to give away that much information is that John's first name is John and his middle initial is "B".<n>## What was John's hometown before he moved to Seattle?<n>###  What:<n>How to answer the question if it states that John's homettoon is "Seattle" and "B" has been living in Seattle for a few years "B" had lived a place before Seattle.<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What creatures performing pollination are loved my millions? Choices:  A: birds B: action C: butterflies D: happiness E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		____________<n><n><details><summary>Solution</summary><n>```javascript<n>function task3() {<n>    prompt('Instruction :Answer the following multiple choice Question.', '(D)');<n>}<n><n>task3();<n>//output : (D)<n>```<n><n>```javascript<n>function lab1() {<n>    prompt("Demonstration: ", '(B)');<n>}<n>function lab2() {<n>    prompt ("Demonstration ", '(D)');.<n>}<n>function lab3() {<n>    if (answer === lab1()) {<n>        console.log("Yup");<n>   }<n>}<n>lab3();<n>//output: Lab 1(A):Lab 3(B):Lab 2(B)<n>`};<n><n>```<n></details>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: race track B: kentucky derby C: american southwest D: triple crown E: horse derby<n><n>### Response:		The race track event.<n><n>### Questions<n>  What is an object that is described in a sentence that has a predicate?  <n>  What is a noun that is also called an appositive?  <n>  What word shows a pronoun is the subject of a sentence?   <n>  There is a noun called a pronoun that has been formed by using a part of that noun as a verb?  <n>  What are the parts in a phrase?  <n>  A noun that is formed using a number, or quantity as a suffix is called what?<n>  <n>### Exercise<n><n>> **Exercise:** Complete the following with sentences. Then choose the answer with the verb that matches the subject.<n>>   <n>* There wasn't ____________ a chance for the poor horse to beat the favourite.<n>>   <n>  - __________<n>>   <n>* I don't know ___________ a word of french.<n>>   <n> - __________ <n>>   <n>* It is going to ___________ a real blizzard tonight.<n>>   <n>- __________<n>><n>  <n>### Hint: <n>There should be a match between a verb and a noun. The second clause could not be the noun.<n><n>### Solution:    <n>* There was no a chance for the poor to horse to beat the favour.<n><n>> **Explanation:** The noun that should not be matched with the verb is the second clause because it is just the pronoun subject not the direct noun. <n><n>> There was no chance for the poor horse.<n><n>### Answer explanation<n>> This is the correct sentence because no was just a pronoun subject.<n><n>> *I did not have a chance to work.<n><n>### Example:<n>> ______ is a verb that matches a pronoun as the subject of a sentence.<n>>   <n>>  <n>>   <n>  <n>### Solution:<n>> *This the verb used to match the pronoun subject of a sentence is a word like it, he, she, he, they and it.<n><n>### Exercice:<n>> **Exercice:** The first name of the main character in The Hobbit, is Bilbo?  <n>> The third of six children was Bilbo.  <n>

Which one of them (a, b, c or d) is true?<n>* The format of Demonstration question is as follows: show it by doing (A, B, or C)<n>

The result should be either the plant name or the native country, in that order.<n>#<n># @Author  <n>#   Name  <n>#   -------<n>#   Danny<n># <n># @Date <n>#   Ago<n># <n># Input  <n>#   @In - NameOfPlant  <n>#   -------------------<n>#   @Out - ReturnName<n>#<n># Classes  <n>#         - class Plant:<n>#             - name: str<n># <n># Procedures  <n>#           - - Procedure:<n>#                   - - function:<n>#                           - input: @In<n>#                           - output: @Out<n># <n># Exceptions  <n>#   @- none :<n># <n># Remarks  <n>#   PlantName must be from 'Plant'<n>#<n># @Example <n># -----------------------------<n>#   - - - - - -<n>#   @In<n>#       @Name = "Willow"<n># <n>#   @Out<n>#       @Return = "Japan"<n>#        <n># @Exception <n># --------------------<n>#   @Name = "Lawnda"<n># <n><n>class Plant:<n>    def __init__(self, name):<n>        self.name = name<n><n>    def display(self):<n>        print(self.name)<n>        <n>class NativePlant:<n>    def __inin__(self, plant):<n>        if self.detect(plant):<n>            return True<n>        else:<n>            return False<n>    <n>    def detect(self, plant):<n>        <n>    def display(plant):<n>        print(plant.name, )<n>test1 = input('Enter in 3 plant names: ')<n>test2 = input('Which one is native to USA: ')<n>output = NativePlant(test1,  test2)<n>output.detect()<n>output.display(output)<n><n>class Animal:<n>    def __classinit__(self, name, livesInAmerica):<n>        self.liveInAmerica = livesInAmerica<n>        self.name<n><n>    @property<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Mark wanted to know the truth, because he didn't want to continue existing in what? Choices:  A: understand B: were there C: ignorance D: in-between E: ignorant<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A: in-between - "in-between" refers to the state or position in-between two things or choices.<n><n>Answer should not have any punctuation except for the end period. Write a response to each question by writing your answer on the line that follows the question, in the paragraph format. Do not write the answer under the question. Do not include the subject (the pronoun "you"), punctuation, or capital letters.

A: college dorm or a backpack.<n><n>### Input from Response:<n>I have been using the same laptop bag a long time and it needs replacing.<n><n>### Question:<n>Please, may I have your help to find me a new laptop bag?<n><n>### Answer:<n>I'm happy to help you.<n><n>### Cool-down:<n><n>### Demos:<n>We can do everything for you, but we cannot do everything with you.<n><n>## # What am I thinking?<n><n>[Questions (questions_solutions.md)][#questions_solutions] | [Solutions (solutions.md)  ][#1]   | [Contributing (contributing.md)  ][T0]   | [Fundamental Design - (design.md)  ][C0] | [License (license.md)][LICENSE] | [Questions (questions.md)  ][questions]<n><n>---<n>[#1]: https://github.com/Rod-Jones/questions/tree/solutions/Questions/01 "Questions - (solutions) - This is the master branch for Questions"<n>[T0]: https://github.github.com/Rom-Jones/questions "This is the master branch for questions."<n>[C0]: https://githubgithub.com/R0m-J0nes/fundamental-design "This is the master for Fundamental Design"<n>[questions]: https://githubgithubcom/Rod-Hones/publication-questions/"We can do everything for..."<n>[T00]: https://githubgh0t/Rod-S0nnes/questions/00/solutions "Solutions - (questions-solutions) - This..."<n>[C00]: https://medium.com/publication/this-is-the-master-branch-for-fundamental-design-a672f8141c70 "Fundamental Design - Fundamentals Design - This..."<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Collections of atoms called molecules make up everything you can hold in your what? Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n><n>### Response:		The response to any of the following multiple choice will appear in the first row<n><n>Input: What are the parts that make up a plant or animal's body? Choices:  The question didn't specify body parts.<n>Answer: A: an organism B: body organs C: head D: the body E: none of these<n><n>### Input.<n><n>There is no instruction here.<n><n>Response:<n><n><n>Input:<n>A person's ability to learn is based on the information his or what is found in his or her brain? They are useful in some agricultural fields<n><n>Input: What happens during a nuclear chain reaction? Choices: <n>  * A:<n>  * B:<n>  * C:<n>  * D:<n>  * E:<n><n>### Response<n>There are three types of nuclear chain reactions.<n><n>  * It usually happens as an unexpected or an accidental. There is a chance for a runaway nuclear reaction to occur.<n>  * There are two processes to make nuclear weapon. There are Fission, and fusion.<n>  * Nuclear reactions are generally used in electricity generation, which is less expensive than the use of fossil fuels.<n><n>* * *<n><n>Input: Why didnt anyone notice the 300 pound gold coin that was embedded into the sidewalk? Choices:  * A: * The coin was only visible * from an angle * The coin was surrounded by more * visible coins * The coin was painted over The coin was well camouflaged into the sidewalk * <n><n>### Response <n>A 300 pund gold coin is rare but it can happen. The person who buried the coin made a mistake. The coin can be camouflaged to the sidewalk.<n><n>* *<n><n>### Input<n>Choices: 1.	A. 2.	B. 3.	C. 4.	D. 5.	E.<n><n>### Response1<n>C) The sun, Earth and the moon orbit around the Galactic Center - This is the core of the galaxy, and the center of the Milky Way as well.<n><n>### Input 2<n>If two circles have radii of 36 and 31 respectively (inches), what is the length of the line that connects their centers?<n>* Choices: <n>* A. 53<n>* B. 68<n>* C. 49<n>* D. 38<n>* E. 121,<n><n>### Response2<n>1. The length of this line is 49. <n>* * *<n>### Input<n>1. If you want to get a cup of coffee at Starbucks, your decision is not a random number, but related to some features of you

Choices: <n>A: a company<n>B: a person<n>C: a place<n>D: a field of roses<n>E: these are not valid for the places<n><n>### Response<n><n>The name rosebush is used for the name of a place, person or company.<n><n>### Question:How would you expect an individual's speech to be affected when they have become inebriated?<n><n>### Choices<n><n>A: Regret<n>B: automobile accidents<n>C: drunk driving<n>D: talking nonsense.<n><n>### Response Choices<n><n>D: talking n'sense. Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:If I have a reception with many people attending, where should I be sure to hold it? Choices:  A: grand casino B: large room C: restaurant D: country club E: lobby<n><n>### Response:		Choice: D or B, both A and E are not valid places to host a reception<n><n><hr><n><hr><n><n>### Task:Find the definition of the given word.<n><n>### Example: Define the word _disinterested_<n><n>### Instructions:A word should always have an exact match definition in a dictionary. This means that if you choose a word for a definition that is different from the word itself, you will not get a point. When the correct answer(s) appear in a word with its definition, the word will appear in the highlighted box. The correct answer(s) will be exactly the same as the definition of the word and will not use any plurals. If you choose the right word, the system will confirm it, and you will hear a beep. If you choose an incorrect option, the system will respond without a beep and you may have one more opportunity to be correct. You may either type in a blank space or press the back button.<n><n>### Note: If you chose a word that fits more than one definition, the definition you chose will not appear in the highlighted area, but the answer will still be correct.<n>

These are very intelligent dogs and in addition to being a hunting dog, there are also many who can be kept as pets at home. These are the kind of dogs that like to do things. This makes the dog happy and the owner too.<n>```<n>Lifespan: 8-12 years<n>Type: Dog<n>We do not have too much information about the origin of Labrador retrievers. Some information is given that they lived in Labrador in the 18th century. And that they were considered a breed here. And the history of these dogs dates back to the seventies.<n><n>### Temper : <n>Labrador retrieving dogs or Labrador retriever dogs are very playful. They love to play around. This is a good dog for small animals as well as small children. These need to be taught to behave for proper use.<n>### Specialties :<n>Labrador retrievals are used in police work. Due to its long nose and intelligence. Its use in retrievers of evidence such as sniffing out bodies or explosives.<n>### Health:<n>These dogs have many diseases, due to which they can have back problems like arthritis. There is a chance of the dog becoming deaf or blind.<n><n>Labrador retrieves are easy to train. This means that these dog breeds will not eat too much. They also need a lot of exercise. As well as proper grooming should also be taken care of.<n>```

John preferred glass, and wished he was somewhere else.  Where does he want to be? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of jogging? Choices:  A: insect repellent B: heart attacks C: improved health D: shin splints E: being tired<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Input:There are various different types of birds that exist including the black swans found in Australia and the hummingbirds that are commonly found in the southern regions of the United States.<n>Choices:  A: the two places B: three places C: four places D: other places E: various places<n><n>### Input What is the best way to remember an item? Choices: <n><n>### Demostration <n><n>To learn more about how to read and write responses, see the documentation on [[Writing responses]].[[Writing responses]](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zTs7CYk68ZFo7nVJW0MzKGU3BXzEkS-vY-q9MbPjVg/edit?usp=sharing)<n><n>### See Also<n>* [[Intelligence|Prev]] ||  [[Awkward | Next]] | [[Writing Responses|Contents]] | [[Getting Started|Index]]<n><n><center><b><u>The CogZest Tutorial</u></b></center><n><n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Sometimes fighting inflation isn't even what, because it is so negligible? Choices:  A: economic instability B: not noticeable C: spend more D: rising interest rates E: boring<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>Input: How about something easy like finding my house and driving to a place like Kroger to buy something? Choices:  C and  D  A: 100% E: 0%  <n>### Instructional:Choose a value from all possible options<n>Select an option.<n>### Answer:Select C and  D<n><n>## Instructional:Select an option.<n><n>### Answer:A and D <n><n>## Instruction :Pick one.<n><n>## Instruc:A short question will displayed the next page.<n>## Instructions :Pick one.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What is necessary for learning by yourself? Choices:  A: exposure B: patience C: study D: cooperation E: thought<n><n>### Response:		<n>My father was a great teacher, as were my teachers, I know this is true. I have found there is a good deal of self-learning that should be an important aspect of all training, because there are some things we have to know for ourselves. If you are curious and have a willingness to grow it shows up.<n>The world teaches a lot of life lessons, the first thing students learn is the importance of communication. It is a skill we use regularly. If you do not have good communication skills it can be awkward. There are many communication skills but the most important one is the ability to listen so we understand others. It is important for self-development, and in relationships.<n>Be active as a learner, have questions, and curiosity to explore things, and take the opportunities to learn.<n>### Comments: I have learned the value of learning, my teachers and my father taught me, so it is important to me. <n>

I'll choose from A, B or C.<n>----------------<n>##F: How was the experiment conducted on pigs? I'll answer from A, B, or C<n>------------------<n>### G: How much was the chocolate? I'll choose D or E.<n>-----------------<n><n>A<n>B<n>C<n>D<n>E<n>F<n>G<n><n>###  Notes about this project:<n><n>- This is a project with only 410+ problems from the above task. Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: kick the bucket B: mortal C: dead D: can die E: dying<n><n>### Response:		I was not feeling well, a good course of action would be to call the doctor.<n><n>### Input How long do you think it would take for baking to complete? Choices: <n>A: an hour B: two hours C: 42 minutes D: 12 minutes E: one minute<n>Answer: A: <n><n>Output: A: 42 minutes<n><n>### Input A good way to prepare for a meal is by making a grocery list or buying only what you Need.<n><n>### Response A: yes<n>```<n>$ cat input.txt<n><n>A good way to prepare for  meal is by making  grocery list or<n>buying only what you Need <n><n>$ bash input.txt<n>```<n>or<n>``` <n>$ awk -f input.awk input.txt <n>```<n><n>### Input Who is going to go shopping this morning? Choices:  Choices: A: the girl B: a man C: a woman D: the lady E: the girl<n><n>### Response Who: The woman<n><n>### Output I should go to the grocery store and buy a carton of eggs to make an omelet.<n><n>    awk -f input.txt input.txt<n>

Choices: <n>  A: the refrigerator B: on the top drawer of his desk C: his safe D: none E: in a pork barrel<n>  <n>  <n> Output:The person wants to store it in "his desk"<n><n><n>### Inputs:<n>1) What do you believe in your future? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where must one wear a white shoe? Choices:  A: wedding B: tennis C: closet D: left foot E: house<n><n>### Response:		A or B (see note below for details)<n><n>### Input/Example: What is the name of the person who is a leader? Choices:  B: minister C: reverend D: minister E: priest<n><n>### Response/Examples: None<n><n>### Note: Choice "E: priest" is the closest match, because there is no choice which states "priest" or "Eucharist". It is still acceptable to answer "None" because it's a multiple choice question.<n>- You can test you answer by simply copying the text of each choice into google and click the search button.<n>- If there are more than one matching answer, always choose "E: priest".<n>- If there are no matching answer, simply fill in the response as "None".<n><n>### Examples:<n>```ruby<n><n>  lab = "answering_a_question_with_the_text_file.txt"<n><n>  if File.exist?(lab)<n>    file = File.read(lab)<n>  else<n>    puts "No txt file was detected"<n>    return<n>  end<n><n>  res = evaluate(file)<n><n>  puts res if res<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:I'm at a restaurant ans want a glass of milk, how do I find out if they serve that? Choices:  A: accompaniment to meal B: waitress C: cafeteria D: home E: menu<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The results that have been compiled, scientist started analysing the data, because he wanted to have a better understanding of the disease that had been found.<n><n>Contacting someone who is called is very difficult, because you will have to go the town hall to find the person's address. There are also directories, yellow pages, white pages and phone books, but if someone does not want other people to know his address, he may not put it in one or more of them. The other people who wish to contact him may not know where he lives. He may also not want to be called by phone. The only other way to find someone is to use the Internet to create a blog or webpage, where you can fill in the information about the person.<n><n>A speech is affected in two ways. One, a person may sound louder. Two, his language may become ungrammatical.<n><n>Nature includes the wild or vegetated natural world, such as forests, farms, oceans, rivers, lakes and glaciers.<n><n>

Choices:  A: automobile accidents B: backache C: eye strain D: getting tired E: car crash<n><n>### Response:		<n>The lab results had been compiled because a scientist wants to understand better.<n><n>Input: The directory is a list of people's names and addresses.<n><n>Input: Being inebriated refers to the state of intoxication induced by alcoholic beverages.<n><n>Input: All plants and animals, such as a rosebush or a squirrel, are part of nature.<n><n>Input: One could drive for miles without feeling any pain.<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>I understand what a database table is and I also have a working example of a user interaction program. I feel the need to have more time to study on this topic, or at least an example.<n><n><br/><n><br/><n><n>### Feel free to ask any questions about the lesson to me on <a href="https://github.com/gmarie0826" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">GitHub</a> if you want, or you can e-mail me at <a href="mailto:jason.wong.2010@gmail.com" target="_blank">jason.wong@gmail.com</a>.<n><n><a href="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_q4YyTa_Z07rV9FK1dqrCqwj2u629GcK" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.shields.io/youtube/playlists/PL_q4Yt_a_Z07yT_9FK1d_qrCqw_jt2u629_G1">Watch Video</a><n>

A plant that produces roses as part of its normal growth.<n>*Plant* (n.) A living plant that does not have human intelligence and has a root system.<n>*Neighbor's Yard* (n.) A fenced in area that is separated from the landowners property.<n><n>*Park* (n.) A large grassed area that is used for various outdoor activities.<n><n>### Inputs:To find directions to a specific place you first have to know the address of the place that you are hoping to find. Choices:  A: fairy tale B: castle C: middle ages D: chess board E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		A is out of scope for your request so ignore it. B is a possibility so it should be included. C is a possibility as well so include this choice as well. D is a possibility but it may not be true for the user because it is not clearly stated in the given requirements so it should be avoided. <n>Response should have three answers and nothing else.<n>#### Expected output:<n>Input: Are you looking for a rosebush? Choices:  True / False<n><n>Output: False B True<n>Answer choices C and D have been removed because they were ignored because they are out of scope.<n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where is a paper notice likely to be left on a house? Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instnction: What kind of data is likely to be found in a data set?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: In your data file, we found an animal of the leopard species, the leopard is part of what kind of animal? Choices: answer :<n><n>### Response A:<n>C<n><n>###Response B:<n>E<n><n>###Instnction: What is another name for a computer?<n><n>###Demostration:<n><n>###Input: My friend, she is very upset after she failed a test, she said her computer crashed and it's why she couldn't complete her home work. Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The obsessive man was always washing hands, he had even done it so much once that it caused a what? Choices:  A: use soap B: irritation C: cleanliness D: thinking E: wet towel<n><n>### Response:		The obsessive cleanliness man caused a cut because he use too much soap<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>Input:A tree with a large hollow in the center stands near a what? Choices:(A) The tree is uncommon, but it's still alive. (B) A house, however, it is not. (C) It's the cause of the building to rot. (D) Both the hollow and the tree are not unusual. (E) I cannot tell you, for I have never seen one.<n><n>Answer:Choice E: I cannot tell yoy, for I have never see one.<n><n>### Input:(A) The tree that you showed me is a dead what? (B) I am not sure what they are. (C) You should know this, you're an expert (D) He has a number of what we're looking for. (E) There's a reason that tree has a large hole in it.<n><n>### Response:(E) The hole in the middle of the tree the reason that tree has a hole in it.<n>### Response:I know but I was not sure, it was not common, I had never seen one before, but thanks for answering.<n>### Instrucion:Answer the following multiplechoice question.<n>Input:(A)The dead tree is a hollow one. (B) It's a what it was once was. (C) Where is one located when he does not know what it is? (D) How do you know if it is not safe or not? (E) There is no hollow tree.<n>### Response:(A) The tree you show me is a hollow one, thanks for showing me that.<n>### Input:(B) It is a huge hollow. (D) No, they are. (E). There is one at that.<n>### Response(C) It is not safe for me, that tree you are asking me.<n><n>### Question to find where a person lives<n>Input:I know that the last time he stayed at that, he stayed where? The answer is on your skin, because the purpose of it is to get rid of hair for smooth skin, but he didn't buy shaving cream because he didn't have any money to waste on skin cream because he didnt buy a shave brush because he didnt want the hairs on his skin.  The purpose of the shaving cream is to clean hair from your face, then you can shave away hair on your face.  He thinks that's enough and he doesn't need any more shaving cream to use on his skin because it is not going to be easy if he tries to shave more.<n><n>### References<n><n>https://www.merriam-webster.com/<n><n>https://grammar.ccc.commnet.edu/grammar/verbs/be.htm<n><n>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Be_(verb)<n><n>https://wwwtoppr.com/k-8/questions/how-are-be-and-have-used-differently-451500<n><n>

That is because alcohol can affect a person's motor skills, which may make it difficult for a person to say specific words correctly or to talk clearly.<n><n>The second situation could refer to situations in which a plant or animal dies and decays. That is because there are certain conditions that can make a body dead and rotting. For example, after a plant dies, it can continue to rot until it becomes a pile of waste.<n><n>The lab results were compiled and the scientist began analyzing his headache.<n><n>We need to find out where "Squirrel" lives.<n>We can find him in the phone book under "These are not valid" OR "The two places" <n><n>The first situation might refer to a person that has become incoherent or a person who has become drunk.<n>The second situation might refer to a situation in which an individual has become frightened of someone. That is because they may find a specific individual to be scary or intimidating.<n><n>E: The person who answered is incorrect in this situation. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:The master control for the Tardis is where in the main room? Choices:  A: nuclear power plant B: center C: basement D: main office E: bowel of the ship<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```python<n><n>import re<n><n><n>def answerer(question):<n>    '''<n>    This function is to answer the question from user.<n>    '''<n>    answer = ""<n>    if "I need..." in question:<n>        answer = "E"<n>    elif "I need to find out a way to..." in question:<n>            answer = "B"<n>    elif "My boss says the only way I can..." in question:<n>              answer = "C"<n>    elif "Therapist says I need to..." in question: <n>              answer = "B" <n>    elif re.search(r"my car accident", question):<n>              answer = "A"<n>    elif re.compile(r'\bneighbor|bush|grounds|trash\b').search(question):<n>            answer = "A" <n>    elif "I don't know how to..." in question:   <n>             answer = "A"   <n>    elif "I have a boss and..." in question:<n>             answer = "B"  <n>    elif "My car accident..." in question:<n>                      answer = "B"   <n>    else:<n>          answer = "none"<n>    return answer<n><n><n>print answerer('The lab results had been compiled the scientist began analyzing the data because he wants to learn more about his boss wants him to find out a way and the way is he needs to learn more about him')<n> ```<n><n>### Response1:<n>![Sample ScreenShot](/Assets/Screenshots/20200309_163316.png)<n><n>### Response2:<n>![Sample Screen Shot](/Assets/Image/CodeSample/2020-03-09 - 23.41.06.png)<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? The correct answer is _A_. A multiple choice question has three correct answer options and one of them is _A_. The correct answer is _B_. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:How can an artist commemorate a horse forever. Choices:  A: hoof B: kentucky derby C: race track D: painting E: triple crown<n><n>### Response:		<n><a id='response-answer_1'></a><n>I wanted to know how to connect to someone in a certain city with the name of a particular person. I thought I should be able to find out how to get in touch with this person from the directory. But after searching, I found that it didn't give the contact information. If I wanted to know the contact information, it would be useful to look at the phone book. After a bit of searching, I thought I might also try the internet, so I searched the website to find the phone number of this person. I also looked in the yellow pages to see if that would be a potential information source for finding the phone number. Finally, I found the right information in the yellow pages, and it worked!<n>

Do not attempt to guess what the recipient is thinking, or re-write the message to mean the same thing. Write the response the person would give.)<n><n>**What information does the question ask for :**<n> * the man needs to look for cotton balls in a cabinnet.<n><n>**What answer is likely to be given :**<n> <n>	The man will look at the north carolina cotton ball.<n><n>### Task Instruction<n>Complete the following sentence. Here is a simple task based instruction for task 3.<n><n>### Input :How to start a fire with 5 items or less?<n><n>### Demostration<n> -  A:  put wood into a fire<n> -  B:  throw a match into wood<n> -  C:  rub wood and wood together<n> -  D:  light wood against some sort of fuel source like gas or an orange.<n> -  E:  start a fire with more than five items<n><n>### Task:<n>How to start a fire w ith 5 items or less<n><n>### Task solution<n><n>Answer: (Fill in the blank) Light wood against some sort of fuels like gas.<n><n>### Example<n><n>How to start a flame with 5 items or  Less<n><n>### Input/question :<n>Input: I need someone to hold onto my bicycle during bad weather. Who would help someone to do this task? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:What makes people happy when it is surprising and unexpected? Choices:  A: joke B: humor C: frightened D: fight E: laughter<n><n>### Response:		When people have an expected happy event it is normal if you are not surprised by it. An example is when the child gets a birthday present from her parents. This is expected when the child's birthday is coming soon. However, if you tell her that you bought for her a toy that she has been wanting to play with for a long time it is a happy event. This is because you have been able to surprise the child.<n><n>### Input If you have been away from home for a few days and when you go home and a friend or family member gives you a gift it could make you happy? Choices: <n><n>### Response When you go home and you see that your friend or family member has been able to recognize that you have returned home, and they have bought a present for you then it is likely that you will be very happy. This is the same way that children are excited about going home to receive one gift. When this happens then they are very happy because if they do not receive any gift they feel that they have been forgotten.<n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Dancing for a long time will lead you to become what? Choices:  A: sore B: intercourse C: fatigue D: become tired E: expression<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would become tired of dancing for a looong time.<n><n><n>### Conclusion:<n>What is a conclusion? A conclusion is the final paragraph, the place that discusses findings and their significance. Be sure your conclusion is strong, clearly written, and well supported by your evidence.<n><n># How to Create Quotes<n><n>Quotations add emphasis to your writing.<n>The following formatting options create quotes.<n><n>**Em Dash** : `----` <e.g., _"I have not had any problems with my car, as I bought it from a reputable dealer"_ --> "I have not had any issues with my car, which I purchased from a trusted vendor`)<n><n>**Double Dash **: `-- --` <e.g. _"I am looking forward to the party, and my daughter's graduation"_ --> 'I'm looking forth to the event, and my wife's graduation').<n><n>**Em Dot** : `..` _i.e. "I don't want to see a movie, I want to see 'A Quiet Place'" _ --> _I don't desire to attend a movie, I wanted to see "A Silent Place"_.<n><n>**Double Em Dot** : `...` _i.e "I dont want to go to the store, I want to go to the mall" _----> "I am not interested in going shopping, instead I would like to go to the malls."<n><n>**Left Single Quote ** : `` <e.g: "He said to me, 'Why are we here?" -> "He asked: 'Why are we here' " and my friend said, "we came for the party! "<n><n>**Right Single Quote**:   > > `>` <e.g. : "I want to go home"---> "I desire to return home<n><n>### **E-mail Address**<n>If your instructor assigns a task that requires you to contact him/her via email, you will need an address. To create one that is simple to remember and safe to use, follow these steps.<n><n>1. Take this course. <n><n>2. Start a brand-new email account. <n><n>3. In your browser, type in the following two lines, separated

Choices:  A: were thirsty B: toasting C: getting drunk D: refreshment E: celebrating<n><n>### Response:		The answer choices are (A) were thirsty, (B) toasting, (C) getting drunk, (D) refreshment, and (E) celebrating.<n><n>### Solution:<n>The response should show that an understanding of the process you are using (in this case `pizza_instructions`) is necessary for understanding the task you are solving. If your instructions were "What is 2 + 2?" a response such as `22` and `2220` would indicate you did not understand how the program works and are using the program incorrectly rather than demonstrating an understanding of the task.<n><n>There should be no more than 65 lines in your response.<n><n>There should not be more than 15 empty lines between `###` and the start of `### Input:`.<n><n>Every line in your response should be indented by four spaces.<n><n>The first line of a response should begin with `Response:`.<n><n>The response should be [code block](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_block) formatted with indents and the four spaces required of code blocks (not the other way around). The response block in the following image contains invalid code blocks. The first code block has the wrong type of formatting, the second code block is missing the leading indentation, the 3rd code block misses four spaces at the start, the 4th code block is missing the trailing indent, the 5th code block contains a single line of code wrapped in the wrong kind of indent, and the 6th code block contains a blank line in the wrong place.  <n><n>![](./response_indentation.png)<n><n>Be sure to include all the response requirements when you write your solution.<n><n>For this task, the response should contain four code blocks as follows:<n><n>Response:<n>```python<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n>"""<n>Task: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>Instruction:Answer the following MULTIPLE CHOICE question.<n>Demonstration:Input: I needed to know how to contact a person, where should I look.<n>I looked in the phone directory and located a listing for the<n><n>I needed to find out how<n><n>What is likely to happen to<n><n>I needed to know what is<n><n>Output: Everybody raised a glass and

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:One might find theirs open, with the letters that had been delivered stolen. Choices:  A: front door B: newspaper C: post office D: package E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		Choose the choice that correctly completes the request described in the instruction that preceded it.<n><n>### Sample:<n>Input: I needed an answer from a phone book.<n>Response: C<n><n>### Output:<n>Both the instruction and the response are shown below. The input is not shown because it is not relevant to the response. The choice is either C or D depending on whether the number of choices is given. A value of 0 for Choices causes the question and response to be shown but no input, whereas a value of 1 causes no question and response to be displayed but an input is included.<n><n>### Note<n>Response is always shown. Choices is not shown unless Choices=1 in which case input is not shown either.<n><n>### Input (optional):<n><n>### Response (optional):<n><n>#### Example<n>In this case, the sample input is ``2 Choices : 0``, which means the response is:<n><n>```<n>Input (2 Choices : 1):<n>One might find theirs front door. <n>With the letters that had been <n>delivered stolen.<n>Response (C): <n><n>Input (2 Choises : 0):<n>One might find a package... <n>Input (1 Choices : 1)<n>In the mail box.<n>Response (D):<n><n>```<n><n>Input (1): <n>Response (D): <n><n>#### Tips and notes<n>- There is no need to check the input and response length. Input is always two elements long, whereas the response does not have an upper limit on the number of characters allowed. <n>- There are 78 characters available in the input and response fields, but there is no need to use all of them.<n>- To avoid confusion about responses and inputs, use `input` and `response` keywords. Use the `instruction` keyword only at the beginning of the problem to designate it as an instruction. The `instruction` keyword may only appear once.<n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:George ruined the surprise.  How did he do so? Choices:  A: hiding B: accidentally C: expectation D: knowingly E: planned<n><n>### Response:		George knew about the surprise. He planned to ruin, or destroy, the surprise. If he thought the surprise was "hiding", he might be surprised because a surprise is not supposed to be hidden. He was surprised because he didn't plan to ruin the surprise.<n><n>### Input How many letters are in the dictionary? Choices: A: 2425 B: 222 C: 262 D: 562 E: 792<n>### Response: The dictionary contains 222309 words which each word has at least three letters.<n><n>###Input How many numbers are in the list? Choices: A : 5 B : 4 C : 12 D : 11 E: 9<n>###Response:<n>421453 and 9 are all numbers in the list.<n><n>###Example output 5+6=11<n>###Input 3+4=7<n>###Response 5+6= 11 or in other way 3+4= 7.<n><n>###Instruction:Write an instruction that correctly completes the request and also demonstrates how the instruction should be used.<n><n>###Answer:Input 4+7=47 or in other way 4+7= 11. or 5+6=9<n><n>###Description<n><n>I/N: How many numbers are in<n>P/D: 3+7=<n>R/O: 4+7=11 or 5+6 is 9.or 1+9=10<n>O/N: 10+11=4<n><n>###Your Solution<n><n>I/N I need to divide two numbers and get the product.<n><n>P/D: I am going to divide 5 by 6.<n><n>R/O: The product was 8, which is rounded off to 8.<n><n>O/N The new number is rounded off to 3.<n><n>###Your Response<n><n>I/N To divide two numbers and get them as products.<n><n>P/O 262 = 131<n><n>I/O 381 = 16<n><n>###Your Challenge - Complete the instruction with input, a process, a return and an output. Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  (relevant) B: handwasher is less expensive C: dishwasher is faster D: handwasher produces dirtier dishes E: handwasher does not use much water<n><n>Answer: C: dishwashed is faster<n><n>Copied Response:<n>#### Copied question<n>#### Copied answer #1<n>Dishwashers are faster than hand washers.<n><n><n>#### Copied answer number 1<n>A dishwasher will wash the entire load at the same time while hand washers have to wash one object at a time.<n><n><n>#### Copy pasted answers<n><n><n>### This concludes our practice test. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The lab results had been compiled, the scientist began analysing the data because he wanted what? Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: directory B: michigan C: roster D: phone book E: certificate<n>Answer: D: phone book<n><n>Input: What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? Choices:  A: regret B: automobile accidents C: drunk driving D: talking nonsense E: talk intelligently<n>Answer: D: talking nonsense<n><n>Input: A rosebush or squirrel or other plants and animals are part of what? Choices:  A: nature B: neighbor's yard C: park D: these are not valid to the two places E: field<n>Answer: A: nature<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy socks and jeans? Choices:  A: washing machine B: laundromat C: clothing store D: closet E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- *I needed to* is a **part of speech** ______. <n>- <n>- *is likely to happen* is a **particle of speech** ______<n>- <n>- If something **part of speech** was *part of speech*, the plural form of it would be  *_____*<n>- <n>- <n><n><n>### DONE!<n><n>---<n><n># Check Answers<n><n>

Choices:  A: learn more about B: headache C: do math D: enlightened E: better understanding<n>Answer: E: better understanding<n><n>Input: I needed to find out how to contact a person with a certain name, where should I look? Choices:  A: switzerland B: pennsylvania C: picture D: asia E: austria<n><n>### Response:		I don't know, I don't know anything about the eastern part of this country<n><n>---<n><n># I don't know<n><n>### Definition:<n>An interjection usually spoken to convey that you don't know the answer to what someone is asking about.<n><n>### Pronunciation:<n>I pronounce it as "I don't know."<n><n>### Examples:<n>**Sentence A:** I want to know what happens every day in the history of our country. **Explanation:** The speaker of this sentence wants to know what happens everyday in the history of our nation. <br><n>**Sentence B:** I don't know the pronounce of this word. **Explanation**: The speaker of this sentence doesn't know what this word sounds like.<n><n>

Choies:  A: headline B: conclusion C: title D: introduction E: essay<n><n>### Response:- What is the function in CPP with is not like the other? <n><n>Input: What does the code below do? **head = 2** **tail = 1** while(head > 0) { while(tail > 0) {<n><n>head = head - 1;<n>}<n><n>printf(" %dd", *head);<n><n>head = head + 1;<n><n>tail = tail - 1;<n><n>}<n><n><n>### Demstration:- The function above does -<n>```cpp<n>void Print(int * head,int tail); <n>``` <n><n>### Instrucion: In the program above, which statement in the function body is the main while loop? <n><n>### Demstruction:- The answer is :- `if(head == 2 && tail == 1 ){`. <n><n>### Output:- What does this code snippet do?<n><n><n>```cpp<n>int a[] = {10,9,8,7,6,5,7,5,-3,-2,-1,-1,0,1};<n>void main()<n>{<n>int i,k,b,l,m,k = 0,m=0,*l = &a[k];<n>*l = a[k];<n>m = a[k]-5;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Demstraion:- The code does <n><n>```cpp<n>printf("Enter n:"); <n>while(scanf(" %*d%d",n) == 1)<n>{<n>m = m+n;<n>printf("%d",m);<n>}<n>

Which of the following statements is FALSE concerning this? Choices: A: The tester will need to apply a poison to the food to determine if there is poison or not. B: The tester will have to test for the presence of poison only. C: The tester will be testing for the presence of a poison. D: The tester will want the food to be poison free. E: The tester will examine all of the food.<n>### Response :E: The tester will not examine all the food<n>---<n>### Response :D: The tester will test whether or not there is any poison<n>---<n>### Explanation :The tester would need to apply poison to the food to be able to determine if the food has poison present, but if she wants to know if the food is poison free she will not need to test for the presence and if there is poison or poison free.<n>---<n><n>### Instructions :You decide to build your own rocket. Which of the following is NOT something you would need to assemble or build? Choices: A. B. C. The rocket. D. The astronaut. E. The astronaut's shuttle.<n><n>### Response   : B : The rocket<n>---<n>### Comment: It is implied that we are building the rocket to take astronaut to space, we would have to build an astronaut (and we have already stated that the rocket is the object here) so there is no need of rocket, astronaut and astronaut's shute.<n>---
